constructor.details: This contract uses OpenZeppelin upgrades and has no need for a constructor function. The constructor is replaced with an initializer function. This method disables the initializer feature of the OpenZeppelin upgrades plugin, preventing the initializer methods from being misused.

getEnd().details: Returns the block number at which the event ends.

getTotalPurchasedValue().details: The given getter shows how much info.unitofaccount was collected within this TSE. To do this, the amount of tokens purchased by all buyers is multiplied by info.price.

getTrustedForwarder().details: Returns the address of the trusted forwarder.

getUserWhitelist().details: This method returns the full list of addresses allowed to participate in the TSE.

returns._0: address An array of whitelist addresses

initialize(address,uint256,(uint256,uint.details: Constructor function, can only be called once. In this method, settings for the TSE event are assigned, such as the contract of the token implemented using TSE, as well as the TSEInfo structure, which includes the parameters of purchase, vesting, and lockup. If no lockup or vesting conditions were set for the TVL value when creating the TSE, then the TVL achievement flag is set to true from the very beginning.

isERC1155TSE().details: This method indicates whether this event was launched to implement ERC1155 tokens.

isTrustedForwarder(address).details: Indicates whether any particular address is the trusted forwarder.

returns._0: 'True' if the whitelist is empty (public TSE) or if the address is found in the whitelist, 'False' otherwise.

maxPurchaseOf(address).details: Shows the maximum possible number of tokens to be purchased by a specific address, taking into account whether the user is on the white list and 0 what amount of purchases he made within this TSE.

_isUserWhitelisted.details: A TSE can be public or private. To make the event public, simply leave the whitelist empty. The TSE contract can act as an airdrop - a free token distribution. To do this, set the price value to zero. To create a DAO with a finite number of participants, each of whom should receive an equal share of tokens, you can set the whitelist when launching the TSE as a list of the participants' addresses, and set both minPurchase and maxPurchase equal to the expression (hardcap / number of participants). To make the pool obtain DAO status only if the distribution is successful under such conditions for all project participants, you can set the softcap value equal to the hardcap. With these settings, the company will become a DAO only if all the initial participants have an equal voting power.

createdAt.details: The block on which the TSE contract was deployed and the event begins

info.details: Parameters for conducting the TSE, described by the ITSE.sol:TSEInfo interface

purchaseOf.details: A mapping that stores the amount of token units purchased by each address that plays a key role in the TSE.

token.details: Mandatory setting for TSE, only one token can be distributed in a single TSE event

tokenId.details: For ERC1155, there is an additional restriction that units of only one collection of such tokens can be distributed in a single TSE

totalPurchased.details: Total amount of tokens purchased during the TSE

token().notice: The address of the ERC20/ERC1155 token being distributed in this TSE

tokenId().notice: The identifier of the ERC1155 token collection
